title: Inside the Long Friendship Between Trump and Epstein
summary: For nearly 15 years, the two men socialized together in Manhattan and Palm Beach, Fla., before a falling out that preceded Mr. Epstein’s first arrest.

title: Trump Sues Wall Street Journal for Article on Note to Epstein
summary: The lawsuit argues that The Journal falsely claimed President Trump “authored, drew and signed” a lewd birthday card to Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Vance Boelter’s Life Before the Minnesota Shootings
summary: Periods of religious zealotry and an unsettled professional career were intertwined for years before he was accused of murder.

title: Why Are More Than 100 People Still Missing in Texas, 2 Weeks After the Floods?
summary: The number of people unaccounted for dropped this week but remains stubbornly high as some searchers lose hope of finding them.

title: A Kite Surfer, Navy SEAL and Makeup Artist: Freed in a U.S.-Venezuela Swap
summary: Over 260 people were released from prisons in El Salvador and Venezuela. Now they face the challenge of coming home.

title: When Getting Fired Is Only the Beginning for Federal Workers
summary: One thing is clear from a reporter’s conversations with laid-off federal workers this year: The cuts have been anything but straightforward and efficient.

title: How Superman Handles a Lois Lane Interview
summary: James Gunn, the screenwriter and director of “Superman,” narrates a sequence featuring David Corenswet and Rachel Brosnahan.

title: James Gunn Didn’t Want to Make ‘Superman.’ What Changed His Mind?
summary: His hit reboot is meant to kick off years of new projects from the rebranded DC Studios. But for a long time, Gunn couldn’t figure out the character.

title: An Ancient Law Could Shape the Modern Future of America’s Beaches. Here’s How.
summary: The growing battle over how to manage sea level rise turns partly on a legal principle set down in Roman times.

title: How TV Shows Like ‘The X-Files’ Trained Us to Be Conspiracy Theorists
summary: Pop culture didn’t create the real-world mythologies roiling our politics, but it helped write the scripts.

title: Driver Purposely Plows Car Into Crowd in L.A., Injuring at Least 30, Officials Say
summary: Seven people were in critical condition after the driver veered onto a sidewalk outside a music club, officials said. The driver was booted from the club earlier in the night for being disruptive.

title: A W.N.B.A. Star Loves These Sneakers. She Gets Fined for Wearing Them.
summary: When an upstart women’s shoe brand made a sponsorship deal with Courtney Williams, a Minnesota Lynx all-star, it put the hugely popular league in an awkward position.

title: W.N.B.A.’s All-Star Weekend Is Still Buzzing, Even Without Caitlin Clark
summary: Despite an injury that sidelined the Fever star, thousands of fans descended on festivities across Indianapolis.

title: What Life Is Like for Four Young Adults Supporting Their Aging Parents
summary: Most young adults don’t expect to support their aging parents. Here’s what happened when four people had to.

title: Is the U.S. Stock Market a Riskier Investment Than Emerging Global Markets?
summary: While the U.S. stock market has rebounded, the combination of the Trump tariffs, a volatile dollar and an erratic bond market has begun to shake global investment thinking.

title: The Kurosawa You May Never Have Heard Of
summary: The great Japanese genre director Kiyoshi Kurosawa, whose latest film is “Cloud,” has mastered the cinema of psychological fright. Here’s why you should watch his work.

title: MAGA’s New Target: Trump
summary: The president is in a deep-state fugue.

title: A Pro-Trump Community Reckons With Losing a Beloved Immigrant Neighbor
summary: Republicans had a point when they complained that Democrats overreached on immigration. But that’s what the G.O.P. is doing now.

title: Syria Declares Cease-Fire After a Week of Upheaval
summary: Sectarian-tinged clashes left hundreds dead and attracted Israeli military intervention. A U.S. envoy said Israel and Syria had agreed to a truce.

title: Cram Fire Grows to Largest Wildfire of the Year So Far in U.S.
summary: The fire in Oregon ballooned to more than 95,000 acres amid shifting winds and dry air, but improved weather this weekend was expected to slow its expansion.

title: Astronomer CEO Andy Byron Resigns After Video at Coldplay Concert Exposes Alleged Affair
summary: A video from a concert dominated internet discourse, and it led to the resignation of a company’s C.E.O.

title: Pet Owner Flooded With Puzzling Calls About a Lost Cat While Hers Is Safely at Home
summary: Natasha Lavoie’s phone number appeared on a T-shirt sold online that advertised a fictitious missing cat. She can’t stop the calls from coming.
